author: uptodatedevelopers
title: Updev Community et Cardano Catalyst
description: Even though we have a strong local community of devs, they have limited skills in blockchain tech and no way to access the information.

assessments.note: "meet-ups" are fairly ambiguous and metrics around how this actually meets the challenge will be difficult to measure. That said, it seems to be a hyper-local solution from a team in tune with their local dev community.
developers in multiple parts of the ecosystem is certainly a major part of the mission and this is a big step forward to have a leader group like this building.

It is a fantastic idea and one needed to promote adoption and integration of blockchain technology for the improvement in the region while also opening the opportunity to tap into Cardano's long term goals in Africa. It would be good to show a detail plan of the topics of the presentation, how many times in the year it will be promoted and a feedback from the amount of people expected to join the sessions.

The idea is good and synergises with the sideproposals that are submitted by the same group.
To improve this proposal, shorten the problem statement and fix the partially translated title.

The focus of the proposal is to bring more people from the community to learn blockchain and functional programming languages, but there are few details about the content that will be covered in this course/events and what is the expectation of complexity of the course and this makes it difficult to measure the impact on the developers ecosystem, regardless the proposal addresses the challenge of this.

The problem statement is subjective. Don't developers have ways to access information? There is material about Plutus and Marlowe available to developers, we can question the ease of reaching this material or the quantity and quality, but saying that there is no way to access this information is not correct.
Progress looks to already be happening towards this, just need small amount of funds to scale and add value.
Looks like the framework is already in place and this will get it fully rolling

Based on the proposer the experience is there to promote a basic format of the blockchain technology and the benefits and long term vision of Cardano in the region. This could create links and interest form other developers and Entrepreneurs on board other projects that can help drive the changes. No-one knows best that your own community how to organize and present the information needed that members of the community there.
Pretty much everything is covered in the proposal. I do not see any uncertain factors.

There is a reasonable description of the idea, but not enough details about what will be taught about blockchain / functional programming. As one of the defined metrics of the proposal is the number of trained functional programmers, it is important that we understand what will be covered in the course to be able to understand the plan and the mission in relation to the challenge.

There are no details on who is involved in the proposal and their qualifications, considering the fact that a teacher with skills in functional programming language will be necessary, it is crucial that details about their experience / qualifications are clear. It was mentioned that WADA will participate with educational support, but without knowing who the people at WADA are going to participate in, it is not possible to measure the chances of success.
Some of the hurdles were addressed i.e. government oversight. Really no way to ensure these meetings bring devs further into Cardano ecosystem and, again, the metrics will be hard to measure.
It appears that this proposal will be a great success at its own level, would like to see more of the road map but in its scope it is good.

Ther eis the passion to onboard others into the project and increase awareness to the solution. More clarity needs to be communicated as to virtual, physical meetups, how many in the span of the year and what outline of topics are addressed could present more confidence in the proposal's deployment of its solution.

The proposal has the potential to address the challenge, but some details need to be added so that we can understand the feasibility of the proposal and its potential impact on the developer ecosystem.

I recommend the inclusion of a roadmap, milestones and objective KPIs (reasonable metrics were mentioned, but without defining KPIs, the success assessment is extremely subjective).

The proposal describes a detailed budget, but there are no details on who(who is the teacher?) is involved in implementing the proposal and their skills.

All necessary information is present.
My only suggestion is to elaborate on how these events would be advertised.

solution: Host regular meet ups with blockchain developers from WADA's network to engage the community and erase the barriers around blockchain tech.
experience: Highly enthusiastic and engaged group of local developers, WADA network educational support
